sen.j: 入之波温泉（しおのはおんせん）は、奈良県吉野郡川上村 (奈良県)（旧国大和国）にある温泉。
sen.e: Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring (Shionohaonsen) is a hot spring in Kawakami Town, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture (former Yamato Province).
Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring (Shionohaonsen) is a hot spring in Kawakami Village, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture (former Yamato Province).
Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring (Shionohaonsen) is a hot spring in Kawakami Village, Yoshino County, Nara Prefecture (former Yamato Province).

sen.j: 公共交通機関：近畿日本鉄道大和上市駅から奈良交通バスで湯盛り温泉杉の湯行きで「湯盛温泉杉の湯」で乗換え、入之波泉行き終点下車すぐ。
sen.e: Public transportation: take Nara Kotsu Bus, Yumori Onsen Hot Spring, Sugi no Yu-bound, from the Yamato-Kamiichi Station of Kinki Nippon Railway Company, get off the bus at `Yumori Onsen Sugi no Yu (Cedar Hot Spring)' and transfer to the bus, Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring-bound and get off the bus at the last us stop.

Public transportation: take a bus of Nara Kotsu Bus which is bound for Yumori Onsen Sugi no Yu, at Yamato-Kamiichi Station of the Kinki Nippon Railway Company, get off the bus at `Yumori Onsen Sugi no Yu (Cedar Hot Spring)' to transfer to a bus bound for Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring, and get off the bus at the last stop, which is close to Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring.

Public transportation: take a bus of Nara Kotsu Bus which is bound for Yumori Onsen Sugi no Yu, at Yamato-Kamiichi Station of the Kinki Nippon Railway Company, get off the bus at `Yumori Onsen Sugi no Yu (Cedar Hot Spring)' to transfer to a bus bound for Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring, and get off the bus at the last stop, which is close to Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring.

sen.j: 車：西名阪自動車道郡山インターチェンジ (奈良県)より約90分。
sen.e: By car: approximately 90 minutes from Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway Koriyama Interchange (Nara Prefecture).
By car: approximately 90 minutes from Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway Koriyama Interchange (Nara Prefecture).
By car: approximately 90 minutes from Nishimeihan Jidoshado Expressway Koriyama Interchange (Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 含炭酸重曹泉（山鳩湯）
sen.e: Alkaline carbondioxated springs (Yamabatoyu hot spring)
Alkaline carbondioxated springs (Yamabatoyu hot spring)
Alkaline carbondioxated springs (Yamabatoyu hot spring)

sen.j: 源泉温度39.0℃。
sen.e: Spring source temperature 39.0 degree.
Spring source temperature 39.0 degrees Celsius.
Spring source temperature 39.0 degrees Celsius.

sen.j: 単純泉（五色湯）
sen.e: Simple thermal hot spring (Goshikiyu hot spring)
Simple thermal hot spring (Goshikiyu hot spring)
Simple thermal hot spring (Goshikiyu hot spring)

sen.j: いずれの泉質も源泉温度が低い。
sen.e: In every hot spring, the source temperature is low.
In every hot spring, the source temperature is low.
In every hot spring, the source temperature is low.

sen.j: 吉野川の源流に近い山奥、大迫ダムのほとりに2軒の旅館「山鳩湯」、公営の「五色湯」が存在。
sen.e: There are two Japanese Inns, `Yamabatoyu hot spring,' and a public Japanese Inn, `Goshikiyu hot spring,' on the banks of Osako dam, deep in mountains close to the headstream of Yoshino-gawa River.

There are two Japanese-style inns, one is `Yamabatoyu hot spring,' the other is publicly-owned `Goshikiyu hot spring,' on the banks of Osako dam, deep in mountains close to the headstream of Yoshino-gawa River.
sen.cmt: Wikipediaによれば「五色湯」は2009年5月に閉鎖されているようですが、取りあえず原文通りに訳出しています。表現の見直し
sen.e: There are two Japanese-style inns, one is `Yamabatoyu hot spring,' the other is publicly-owned `Goshikiyu hot spring,' on the banks of Osako dam, deep in mountains close to the headstream of Yoshino-gawa River.

sen.j: 泉質は全く異なる。
sen.e: The spring quality of those two hot springs are completely different.
Spring quality of each of these two hot springs is completely different from each other.
Spring quality of each of these two hot springs is completely different from each other.

sen.j: そのうちの山鳩湯は、成分の多い濁り湯で有名。
sen.e: Yamabatoyu hot spring is famous for the opaque hot spring which includes many constituents.
Yamabatoyu hot spring is famous as an opaque hot spring which includes many constituents.
sen.cmt: is famous for the opaque hot spring --> famous as an opaque hot spring
sen.e: Yamabatoyu hot spring is famous as an opaque hot spring which includes many constituents.

sen.j: 湯船は本来は木の浴槽でありながら、そうであることは全く分からないほどに黄褐色の石灰質の析出物が付着している。
sen.e: Brownish yellow calcareous deposits adhere to the inner part of bathtub to the extent that someone can't recognize that the bathtub is made from wood.
Brownish yellow calcareous deposits adhere to the inside of a bathtub to the extent that people cannot recognize that the bathtub is made of wood.
Brownish yellow calcareous deposits adhere to the inside of a bathtub to the extent that people cannot recognize that the bathtub is made of wood.

sen.j: 巨大なケヤキの切り株で造られた露天風呂は特に付着が激しい。
sen.e: Especially, an open-air bath made of Japanese zelkova stump is covered in full of deposits.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Especially, an open-air bath made of a huge Japanese zelkova stump is covered with a lot of deposits.
Especially, an open-air bath made of a huge Japanese zelkova stump is covered with a lot of deposits.

sen.j: 湯の落ちる先には二股ラジウム温泉の石灰華を思わせる温泉成分から成る断崖が見られる。
sen.e: The point where hot water drops has a cliff that consists of hot spring constituents, which looks like the calcareous sinter of Futamata Radium Onsen Hot Spring.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The point where hot water drops has a cliff that consists of hot spring constituents, which looks like the calcareous sinter of Futamata Radium Onsen Hot Spring.
The point where hot water drops has a cliff that consists of hot spring constituents, which looks like the calcareous sinter of Futamata Radium Onsen Hot Spring.

sen.j: 毎分500Lの湧出量がある。
sen.e: It springs 500 liters every minute.
It springs 500 liters every minute.
It springs 500 liters every minute.

sen.j: 大台ヶ原山に向かう登山道の途中に、江戸時代の湯治.E6.B9.AF.E6.B2.BB.E5.A0.B4であった五色湯跡があり、現在も温泉が湧いている。
sen.e: On the way of the climbing trail up to Mt. Odaigahara, there is a site of Goshikiyu hot spring which was E6.B9.AF.E6.B2.BB.E5.A0.B4 of hot spring cure site in the Edo period, and hot spring still comes out even today.
On the way of the climbing trail up to Mt. Odaigahara, there is a site of Goshikiyu hot spring, which was a hot spring cure site in the Edo period, and hot spring still comes out even today.
sen.cmt: 「江戸時代の湯治.E6.B9.AF.E6.B2.BB.E5.A0.B4であった」の部分を「江戸時代の湯治場であった」（Wikipediaによる）と解釈して訳出しています。
sen.e: On the way of the climbing trail up to Mt. Odaigahara, there is a site of Goshikiyu hot spring, which was a hot spring cure site in the Edo period, and hot spring still comes out even today.

sen.j: 但し、ここで湧出しているお湯は五色湯旅館で使われていない。
sen.e: However, the hot spring water which came out here is not used in Goshikiyu Ryokan Inn.
However, the hot spring water which comes out here is not used in Goshikiyu Ryokan Inn.
However, the hot spring water which comes out here is not used in Goshikiyu Ryokan Inn.

sen.j: 古くから薬湯として知られ、平安時代にはすでに温泉として開湯されていた歴史がある。
sen.e: It has been known as kusuriyu (medicated bath) since ancient times, and it was opened as a hot spring before the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It has been known as kusuriyu (medicated bath) since ancient times, and it was opened as a hot spring as early as the Heian period.
sen.cmt: before the Heian period --> as early as the Heian period
sen.e: It has been known as kusuriyu (medicated bath) since ancient times, and it was opened as a hot spring as early as the Heian period.

sen.j: 江戸時代には湯治に訪れる人も多かった。
sen.e: Many people visited for hot spring cure in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Many people visited for a hot spring cure in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: hot spring cureに冠詞aを付与
sen.e: Many people visited for a hot spring cure in the Edo period.

sen.j: 1973年に大迫ダムが完成した際に温泉はダムに沈んだが、その後ボーリングによって源泉を掘り当て、山鳩湯旅館が営業を始めて温泉は復活した。
sen.e: The hot spring sank below the water when Osako dam was completed in 1973, but the hot spring revived by Yamabatoyu Ryokan Inn after the source was struck by boring.
The hot spring sank under water when the construction of Osako dam was completed in 1973, but the hot spring revived later in Yamabatoyu Ryokan Inn when the source was struck by boring.
The hot spring sank under water when the construction of Osako dam was completed in 1973, but the hot spring revived later in Yamabatoyu Ryokan Inn when the source was struck by boring.

sen.j: ダムに沈んでから復活した温泉は、他にも日中温泉、鶴の湯温泉 (東京都)、大牧温泉、猿ヶ京温泉、大塩温泉 (福島県)などがある。
sen.e: Aside from Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring, there are hot springs that revived after being sunk into a dam including Nichu Onsen Hot Spring, Tsurunoyu Hot Spring (Tokyo), Omaki Onsen Hot Spring, Sarugakyo Onsen Hot Spring, Oshio Onsen Hot Spring (Fukushima Prefecture).

Aside from Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring, there are hot springs that revived after being sunk under water due to a dam including Nichu Onsen Hot Spring, Tsurunoyu Hot Spring (Tokyo), Omaki Onsen Hot Spring, Sarugakyo Onsen Hot Spring, and Oshio Onsen Hot Spring (Fukushima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: sunk into a dam --> sunk under water due to a dam
sen.e: Aside from Shionoha Onsen Hot Spring, there are hot springs that revived after being sunk under water due to a dam including Nichu Onsen Hot Spring, Tsurunoyu Hot Spring (Tokyo), Omaki Onsen Hot Spring, Sarugakyo Onsen Hot Spring, and Oshio Onsen Hot Spring (Fukushima Prefecture).
